CatDescriptText: image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 16, 1954, pg. 16, reads: "'Aida' Makes Curtain - 'Aida,' presented by the National Negro Opera Foundation, Inc., and its Pittsburgh Opera Guild, at Syria Mosque Saturday night overcame difficulties and answered critics of the effort by giving a commendable performance. It was a tribute to Mme. Mary Dawson, founder and organizer of the NNOF, and her associates...in their Egyptian costumes and smiling after the performance was over, left to right, "Butch" Hawthorne, Jean Marie-Jefferson and Orrin Jackson."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of "Butch" Hawthorne, Jean Marie Jefferson, and Orrin Jackson wearing Egyptian costumes for National Negro Opera Company performance of "Aida"
